intro: Connarus mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao connarus, is a flowering plant species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
